meanings.definition: A concluding section of a literary work, often providing closure or summarizing key points.
meanings.sent1: The epilogs in fairy tales usually reveal the moral of the story.
meanings.sent2: After finishing the book, I always look forward to reading the epilogs.
meanings.sent3: The epilogs in mystery novels sometimes hold the biggest surprises.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a series of epilogs, each chapter closing with a lesson learned.
meanings.sent5: The epilogs in movies often tie up loose ends and leave the audience satisfied.

meanings.definition: To write or provide an epilog for a piece of writing or performance.
meanings.sent1: She epilogs her stories with thoughtful reflections on the characters.
meanings.sent2: Authors often epilogs their novels to give readers a sense of closure.
meanings.sent3: He epilogs his speeches with a touch of humor to leave the audience smiling.
meanings.sent4: The playwright epilogs the play with a poignant monologue from the main character.
meanings.sent5: As a writer, she enjoys epiloging her articles to leave a lasting impression on the readers.
